title: How to Choose Flowers from the Garden for Making Potpourri

steps.headline: Choose any one or a combination of the following flowers:
steps.description:

steps.headline: Make the potpourri.
steps.description:
The flowers and leaves will be slowly dried out during the potpourri process, provided you use the right ingredients and old-fashioned method:
Layer the flowers and leaves in salt. Store in a sealed container for two weeks. Add herbs, spices and the orris root fixative (2 to 4 tablespoons). Seal the mixture and leave to infuse for another six weeks.

text:
Choose any one or a combination of the following flowers: Calendula (marigold) Choisya Lily of the valley (Convallaria) Jasmine Sweetpeas Lilies Honeysuckle Stock (matthiola) Paeonies Pansies Philadelphus (mock orange) Rose petals{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Choose-Flowers-from-the-Garden-for-Making-Potpourri-Step-1Bullet12.jpg/v4-460px-Choose-Flowers-from-the-Garden-for-Making-Potpourri-Step-1Bullet12.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Choose-Flowers-from-the-Garden-for-Making-Potpourri-Step-1Bullet12.jpg/v4-760px-Choose-Flowers-from-the-Garden-for-Making-Potpourri-Step-1Bullet12.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

Choose any of the following tree parts: Eucalyptus leaves Gumnuts Flowers from the tree. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Choose-Flowers-from-the-Garden-for-Making-Potpourri-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Choose-Flowers-from-the-Garden-for-Making-Potpourri-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Choose-Flowers-from-the-Garden-for-Making-Potpourri-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Choose-Flowers-from-the-Garden-for-Making-Potpourri-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make the potpourri. The flowers and leaves will be slowly dried out during the potpourri process, provided you use the right ingredients and old-fashioned method: Layer the flowers and leaves in salt. Store in a sealed container for two weeks. Add herbs, spices and the orris root fixative (2 to 4 tablespoons). Seal the mixture and leave to infuse for another six weeks.
